description.narrative: IR 2.6 By 2013, support to Government results in increase to access to water and sanitation and hygiene among rural population (252, 273) from 39% to 45% and 30% to 36% respectively., which contributes to Hygiene, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Sanitation, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Child and Maternal Mortality are reduced through more equitable access to quality health, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
